title: Stimulus optimism boosts stocks, eases pressure on bonds
text: World stock markets rose on Monday on signs that major economies would look to prop up stalling growth with fresh stimulus measures, easing pressure on bonds and dampening demand for perceived safe-havens such as gold.

title: Stocks Advance Globally As Treasury Yields Climb: Markets Wrap
text:
European stocks rose with U.S equity futures alongside shares in Asia as traders parsed the latest trade news from Washington and awaited Federal commentary
The post Stocks Advance Globally As Treasury Yields Climb: Markets Wrap appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Oil rises after drone attack on Saudi field
text: Crude oil prices rose on Monday following a weekend attack on a Saudi oil facility by Yemeni separatists and as traders looked for signs that Sino-U.S. trade tensions could ease.

title: Huawei's first 5G phone goes on sale in China as it pushes ahead with launch despite US pressure
text: China's 5G networks are expected to come online in late 2019 and 2020. Huawei's Mate 20 X 5G, which went on sale over the weekend, will be able to connect to those networks.

title: Global dividends hit new high but growth slows to just 1.1%
text: Financial companies achieve fastest rise but technology sector payouts fall

title: US tech firms will likely influence decision on whether to extend Huawei's license, IDC says
text: This is as much about the pressure that U.S. components suppliers are exerting on the government as opposed to punishing Huawei, Crawford Del Prete, president at IDC.

title: Cathay Pacific shares in choppy trade after shock exit of CEO Hogg
text: Cathay Pacific  shares were choppy in opening trade on Monday after the shock exit of CEO Rupert Hogg, as the airline grapples with mounting Chinese scrutiny over the involvement of some of its staff in anti-government protests in Hong Kong.
